text: The Jolly Roger will always hold a place in my heart.  This was my dad's favorite pizza place, and I have a lot of fond memories of eating here with him.  I was very sad to see it closed, but I'm holding out hope that it will one day reopen.  The thin cracker crust pizza's were absolutely amazing, and I loved them so much, that I never tried anything else.
Closed.  Was very marginal its last few years.  Poor service, even the thin-crust pizzas, which were the only things worth eating, started to slide badly.
Awful place. Both food and ambience (what ambience? It's more like an old age home). I'm not surprised that they're closed.
